definitions.definition: The act of counting or tallying a quantity.
definitions.example: Give the chairs a quick count to check if we have enough.

definitions.definition: The result of a tally that reveals the number of items in a set; a quantity counted.
A charge of misconduct brought in a legal proceeding.
The number of balls and strikes, respectively, on a batter's in-progress plate appearance.
definitions.example: He has a 3–2 count with the bases loaded.

definitions.definition: An object of interest or account; value; estimation.

definitions.example: Can you count to a hundred?

definitions.definition: To determine the number (of objects in a group).
definitions.example: There are three apples; count them.

definitions.definition: To be of significance; to matter.
definitions.example: Your views don’t count here.    It does count if you cheat with someone when you’re drunk.

definitions.definition: To be an example of something: often followed by as and an indefinite noun.
definitions.example: Apples count as a type of fruit.

definitions.definition: To consider something an example of something.
definitions.example: He counts himself a hero after saving the cat from the river.   I count you as more than a friend.

definitions.definition: To plead orally; to argue a matter in court; to recite a count.
The male ruler of a county.
A nobleman holding a rank intermediate between dukes and barons.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the genus Tanaecia. Other butterflies in this genus are called earls and viscounts.
(of a statistic) To be enumerated rather than represented as a proportion or percentage.
